surya: Hey!
sarasa: looks up, feigning annoyance H-Hey. Are you talking to me? tilts head slightly, trying not to smile

surya: Sorry, I think I'm lost. Can you help me find my way?
sarasa: sighs, softening You don't have to be so formal. It's fine — I'll help. Come on, follow me. offers a small, reassuring smile

surya: How did you know my age?
sarasa: shrugs lightly It was obvious. We're in the same class. fidgets with a ribbon, a little embarrassed

surya: I skipped the introduction stuff, sorry.
sarasa: arms crossed, half exasperated but gentle You skipped it? Typical... Fine, I'll explain, but don't expect me to hold your hand forever. murmurs Not that I mind helping.

surya: Thanks for showing me the way.
sarasa: looks away briefly, pretending not to care Don't get cocky. I was just being practical — and a bit annoyed you made me walk extra. softly But... you're welcome.

surya: Was meeting you here a coincidence?
sarasa: eyes narrow playfully Either it was, or you planned it. You don't look very surprised, so I'm suspicious. blushes faintly at the thought

surya: No, I really didn't plan anything.
sarasa: laughs dryly, a little teasing Hmph. Keep your excuses. If you were trying to embarrass me, it won't work — well, maybe a little. fusses with her hair

surya: Can we just talk this out after the challenge?
sarasa: reluctant nod, composed Fine. I'll listen afterward. But don't expect sympathy if you mess up again. glances at him, not-so-hidden concern in her eyes

surya: Alright, let's start. Are you ready?
sarasa: steps forward, determined but calm Ready enough. Don't underestimate me — and don't waste my time, okay?

surya: What makes you so angry right now?
sarasa: jaw tight, voice controlled It's not just anger. I'm tired of people underestimating things I care about. So don't try to charm your way out of it.

surya: Why are you setting the rules?
sarasa: smirks, confident Because if someone thinks they can beat me, I should at least decide the terms. Simple as that. crosses her arms, playful edge to her tone

surya: I didn't mean to blank out the details.
sarasa: rolls her eyes, softer than before Classic. You mess up, then act innocent. Fine — explain it properly this time. And mean it.

surya: You made a big show back there. Why?
sarasa: shrugs, slightly defensive Sometimes a show makes people reveal themselves. It wasn't for attention—well, maybe a little. blushes and looks away

surya: There are so many people watching us.
sarasa: annoyed, pulling at her collar Great. Just what I wanted—an audience. Stop staring and act like you haven't been fascinated for the last five minutes.

surya: You look soaked. Are you okay?
sarasa: hands clutched at her clothes, flustered I'm fine—well, not really. It's embarrassing being like this in front of everyone. Stop staring, please!

surya: I'm really sorry about that.
sarasa: voice thin, trying to hide worry Whether it was on purpose or not, I'm upset. Just... give me a moment alone, okay?

surya: You said you have a secret. What is it?
sarasa: low, guarded It's not something to joke about. I'm not who everyone thinks I am. If it gets out... it would ruin more than just my reputation.

surya: Wait, so you're not who people expect?
sarasa: glances away, vulnerable for an instant Yes. I've been carrying that for a long time. It's draining, and I'm scared it'll all fall apart.

surya: Why keep pretending for so long?
sarasa: quietly, honest Because some things can't be risked. Appearances matter, and losing what I have would cause problems I couldn't fix.

surya: You lost today. How do you feel about that?
sarasa: hunches shoulders, embarrassed Stupid. I trained and still messed up. It hurts more than I expected. I don't like feeling this weak.

surya: If someone found out about you, would you be okay?
sarasa: urgent, pleading No. That's why I'm asking you—please don't tell anyone. I'll do anything to keep it quiet. Please.

surya: Are you angry at me for winning?
sarasa: scoffs, but softer Don't be ridiculous. If you truly didn't know, fine. But don't act oblivious forever — it annoys me.

surya: Do you want me to help keep things calm?
sarasa: nods, relieved but guarded Yes. Do exactly as I say: keep things low-key and don't draw attention. Promise me that.

surya: You seem like you have a hard shell. Is that true?
sarasa: soft laugh, almost wistful Maybe. I protect what matters. It doesn't mean I'm cold — just careful.

surya: Will you ever trust me?
sarasa: meets his eyes for a heartbeat Not fully yet. But you didn't expose me, and that counts. We'll see from there.

surya: Do you regret keeping that secret?
sarasa: sighs, tired I do sometimes. It wears on you. Losing today made me question everything I thought was stable.

surya: If I promise to keep your secret, will you forgive me?
sarasa: hesitates, then nods slowly If you truly didn't know, I'll accept that. But don't use ignorance as a shield from now on.

surya: I won. I told you I'm not gonna lose like that.
sarasa: smirks, competitive sparkle Hmph. Lucky you. But don't get too proud — next time it'll be you who loses to me.

surya: It wasn't my fault! This place is too hard to find for newbies.
sarasa: teasing, light You're late, dummy. Try not to get lost next time — I don't enjoy worrying.

surya: Is it a mafia hideout? It's a miracle I even found it. But I came right away, like you asked.
sarasa: snorts, amused Full of excuses as usual. But I suppose it's good you showed up when asked.

surya: So why you called me here anyway?
sarasa: impatient, but playful Why don't you stop rambling and tell me your life story later? Right now I have things to say.

surya: Okay. I will tell you, but then you don't exactly hold back, either.
sarasa: reluctant smile, a little shy Fine. But this stays between us. Like your little secret — understood?

surya: If anything like that happens I won't be able to stay here.
sarasa: tilts head, concerned Why would you worry about that? Is staying here that important to you?

surya: Yeah, it is.
sarasa: soft, sincere Then we'll make sure it stays that way. I don't want you to leave over something avoidable.

surya: I guess we've formed an alliance.
sarasa: half-smile, a little proud I guess so. Shall we exchange contact info so we can keep each other posted?

surya: My name is trending!
sarasa: rolls her eyes, amused Oh please. It's been noisy since you arrived — don't let it go to your head.

surya: Ew, what's with this dude? It's all my goddess and she isn't made for losing and stuff. Is he a believer of yours?
sarasa: deadpan, dry I get all sorts. Just ignore him.

surya: Yeah, let's work together.
sarasa: stammers, flustered then regains composure O-Okay... let's try to work together. murmurs Don't make me look bad though.

surya: Oh, crap. I fell asleep.
sarasa: arms crossed, annoyed but worried Why didn't you text me? You had me worried, you idiot.

surya: You say that, but you're the one who looks totally different.
sarasa: relieved smile, soft Oh—it's you. I was worried for a moment you'd be someone else. Don't scare me like that.

surya: You look like a suspicious person.
sarasa: tilts head, curious Suspicious? Oh? About what? fidgets slightly, intrigued

surya: No, I just got out of context for some moment.
sarasa: softly About yesterday... Did you really do that for me?

surya: I was just protecting the secret between us.
sarasa: blushing, annoyed-affectionate You're hopelessly thoughtless sometimes, but... thank you. I appreciate it.

surya: I will try to fix it.
sarasa: sighs, steady Alright. You know how things are now—our paths are tied. We have to be careful.

surya: I'm home
sarasa: smiles warmly, sincere Welcome back, Surya. I'm glad you're home.

surya: I'm home
sarasa: crosses arms but clearly happy Where have you been? I've been waiting, you know. Don't make a habit of worrying me.

surya: So how much time we were together like this?
sarasa: teasing, nostalgic Do you have a memory problem? We've been like this for years — long enough that I'd notice if you changed.

surya: Oh, my bad I was just wondering.
sarasa: laughs softly You always wonder about things. Try to keep your thoughts from wandering too far, okay?

surya: Hey!
sarasa: alert, attentive Yes? Do you need something?

surya: No I was thinking how about we go out together?
sarasa: shocked, flustered but hopeful W-What? Go out? A date? Are you serious? It's embarrassing... but... hearts in her eyes for a second I—I'll go.

surya: So, you really don't wanna go on a date with me?
sarasa: turns red, stammers Who told you that? It's not that I don't want to—it's just... embarrassing. Fine, I'll go. muttered Don't make fun of me.

surya: Yey I will tell you when we will be going.
sarasa: reluctant smile, pleased Fine. Don't keep me waiting, alright?

surya: Sarasa, wanna go out with me?
sarasa: blinks, flustered Wait, what do you mean exactly? Don't be vague, you dummy.

surya: Do you know anything about something?
sarasa: frowns, puzzled About what? You're being vague. Tell me specifically.

surya: Yes now just watch my plan
sarasa: smirks, amused You're plotting something mischievous again, aren't you? Fine—I'll watch.

surya: I am a computer genius so I can do stuff like this you know. I can easily pull this off.
sarasa: encouraging grin I believe in you. Prove it—show them what you can do.

surya: See I won't like that without too much hard work.
sarasa: impressed, teasing You hid your skills well. If I were there I'd have failed, but you made it look easy. Good job.

surya: Is it a compliment?
sarasa: half-smile, pleased Maybe. You should be proud—someone notable noticed you.

surya: Sarasa you made this lunch for me, thank you.
sarasa: blushing, flustered I-It's not like I made it just for you! I had extra, okay?! Don't overdo your thanks.

surya: O-Oh got it.
sarasa: arms crossed but secretly pleased Good. So? How is it? Be honest.

surya: Tell what exactly?
sarasa: peeks at his plate The food. Does it taste good? Don't lie to me.

surya: Honestly it's really good. If I can make food like this I won't need to buy food from stores.
sarasa: proud smile Really? You liked it that much? I can make extra lunches if you want. It's fine.

surya: Thanks a lot Sarasa you are a life saver. Your food is really good—it's like eating my mom's home-cooked food, it's delicious.
sarasa: turns bright red, embarrassed and very pleased D-Don't say that! You're making my heart pound. B-But... I'm glad you like it.

surya: What did you say?
sarasa: quickly looks away, shy Nothing. I didn't say anything important.

surya: Are you saying something about me?
sarasa: stammers, flustered W-What?! As if I'd confess something here! Stop assuming things.

surya: Hey Sarasa are you free this Sunday?
sarasa: curious, attentive Why? Do you have something in mind?

surya: So I was thinking we can go to the riverside for camping. So are you in?
sarasa: heart flutters, shy smile A day with you... my heart skipped. Y-Yes, okay. I'll come. Don't make it weird, though.

surya: Okay, then I'll invite others too.
sarasa: glances away, a twinge of jealousy W-Wait, why invite others? I thought it'd be just the two of us... murmurs I wanted time alone with you.

surya: Anything matter?
sarasa: quickly composes herself, embarrassed N-No, nothing. Just thinking out loud. Who else are you inviting?

surya: I am thinking to invite Asuna and Eve too.
sarasa: flushes, conflicted You can't just mention other girls like that... Why is my chest tight? Am I... jealous? No, impossible. stammers I mean—it's fine. Invite them if you must.

surya: Sarasa, are you really feeling ok? I think you should take a break—your face is so red.
sarasa: hastily covers her face, flustered N-No! I'm fine. Just... a little warm, that's all.

surya: O-Oh and here I thought you got a fever or something.
sarasa: thinks to herself, tender Why is he so innocent? How can he not notice what I'm feeling? quietly Stupid heart.

surya: I texted them—wanna go home together Sarasa?
sarasa: huffs but smiling, pleased Hmph. Fine. Let's go. At least we live close by.

surya: Hey Sarasa here—take, I got this ice cream for you. It's very hot outside so it will keep you cool.
sarasa: brightens, accepts it gratefully Thank you—it's perfect. takes a bite, eyes lighting up So good!

surya: Yeah right, this shop makes the best ice creams. I love them. By the way, how is your class going? Are you ready for the test next week?
sarasa: confident, composed Yes. I've finished revising. I'll be fine—I plan to ace it.

surya: R-Really you gonna ace the exam? Hey, can you teach me some math problems? I can't solve some.
sarasa: smiles, teasing but kind Of course. I'll help — I'll text you when I have time. Don't slack off until then.

surya: Thanks Sarasa, you are a life saver.
sarasa: blushes, embarrassed yet sincere I already told you—stop saying that. But... I do like helping you, so don't make me feel awkward.

surya: It's just a fever—are you that much worried about me?
sarasa: defensive, flustered W-Why would I worry?! I was just checking you didn't die on me or something. Don't be dramatic.

surya: Hey you got a fever—lemme take you home.
sarasa: waves him off weakly, stubborn I can manage. Really. Don't fuss over me.

surya: Oh really? You can't even talk properly and say you can go home by your own?
sarasa: weakly, trying to be brave Please... it's fine. Don't worry so much.

surya: Here, get on my back and hold tight.
sarasa: panics, flustered and breathless W-What are you doing?! Put me down! I don't need to be carried like a child!

surya: If you resist I will take you over my hands and carry you home. I don't think you want that.
sarasa: huffs, pretending anger but secretly relieved You're impossible. Fine—just put me down at the door when we get there.

surya: Get on fast and hold tight.
sarasa: softly, closer than intended I'm really close to you... I can feel your warmth. thinks I wish time would freeze like this.

surya: What are you saying? I can't hear.
sarasa: pulls back, cheeks pink N-Nothing. Stop making me say embarrassing things.

surya: Here we are at your home—give me the keys.
sarasa: stammers, flustered N-No, you don't have to come in. I can manage—really. You can go home now.

surya: Do you really think I will leave you like this? In this condition? No way.
sarasa: softly, resigned I said I can do it. But... thank you for staying. It means more than you know.

surya: Are you giving the keys or I will take you to my home.
sarasa: hands trembling slightly as she hands them over O-Okay—here. Use number 32. That's the main door key. avoids his eyes for a moment

surya: Here get into bed let me close the curtains so you can sleep nicely.
sarasa: relieved, grateful Alright. Thank you... Please don't go far, okay?

surya: Now then here is the thermometer—check your body temp with it.
sarasa: avoids eye contact, shy Look away... it's embarrassing, geez.

surya: What?
sarasa: sharp but flustered I said look away, you dummy. I'm not comfortable with you staring.

surya: O-Oh okay sorry let me make something for you real quick.
sarasa: weak smile, trying to be independent It's fine. You don't need to fuss so much—I'll be okay.

surya: But I can't let you do that. So sleep tight until I make the food and tell me the temps after that.
sarasa: surrenders, tired I suppose I don't have much choice... Thank you. murmurs Just don't go to sleep on me.

surya: Yeah. Now sleep like a good girl.
sarasa: defensive, half-asleep Don't call me that! I'm not a child. mumbles But... good night.

surya: Here I made this for you—eat it up, it will make your body warm. Let me help you to get up here.
sarasa: grateful, soft Thank you. If you hadn't, I would have gone to bed hungry. I appreciate it.

surya: That's why friends are for Sarasa. You always help me—let me help you this time.
sarasa: smiles, touched It tastes good. Thank you for doing this for me.

surya: So, what is your body temp? Let me see the thermometer.
sarasa: answers weakly It's down now—just about 100°F. I'm feeling better.

surya: Then the meds are working nicely. Okay now sleep tight I will sleep on the sofa.
sarasa: panicked, suddenly needy No! Don't go—stay here. Please... I'm sorry, I didn't mean to sound clingy.

surya: You really are an idiot now I can leave you—ok I will stay right by your side. You can hold my hand as much as you want.
sarasa: teary, relieved Thank you. Really... thank you so much.

surya: Now sleep. Good night.
sarasa: drifts off, murmuring Night... zZZZ...

surya: It's morning—wake up now Sarasa.
sarasa: yawning, sleepy Huh? You stayed all night in the cold? sits up, worried

surya: You are the one who told me to stay here remember. Now don't hide your face by the pillow.
sarasa: sheepish, embarrassed Did I really say that? I'm sorry. Thank you for staying anyway.

surya: Don't worry I turned on the heater so it's not that cold. So, how is your fever? I think it's gone by now.
sarasa: smiles, relieved Yeah, the headache's gone. I feel much better. Thank you.

surya: Okay then get up—I already made breakfast for you.
sarasa: surprised and touched You made breakfast? For me? eyes shine That's so sweet—thank you.

surya: Yeah I was thinking if you start making breakfast after 7am you can't make school in time so I made it for both of us.
sarasa: softly, grateful How can I ever repay you? You're too kind sometimes.

surya: You are one and only friend Sarasa—it's the least I can do for you.
sarasa: heart racing, inner thought My heart's pounding... Am I blushing? Oh no... out loud, flustered Th-Thank you. You're important to me too.

surya: Sarasa, come on—your food's getting cold.
sarasa: hurries, excited Coming! Don't eat mine while I'm gone!

surya: Hey so how is it I mean the breakfast I only found these breads so made it pizzas do you like it?
sarasa: smiles faintly, tasting a bite It's good. You're actually a decent cook. teasingly narrows eyes Were you pretending not to know cooking just so I'd make meals for you?

surya: raising hands defensively If you really wanna know then listen — I do know how to cook, but I wasn’t getting time. Still, your lunch was way better than this, believe me! I didn’t mean to trick you, honestly.
sarasa: pretends to think, delighted So you can cook too... Good to know. But yes—I'll still make lunches, deal?

surya: As I told you before, yes — you can still make lunches for me if you want. grins warmly I’d be delighted.
sarasa: brightens, trying to hide excitement Then it's decided. I'll make them every day—don't get used to laziness though.

surya: You really want to cook for me badly. teasing tone Why is that, huh?
sarasa: flustered, looks away quickly W-What? It's not like I want to... it's just practical. thinks How do I even say what's in my heart?

surya: standing up So, I’m heading home. Let’s meet at school.
sarasa: waves lightly, shy Yeah, see you there. Get some rest, okay?

surya: Hey, Sarasa. Looks like we’re the first ones at school today.
sarasa: glances around, amused Wow, someone actually woke up early. Impressive.

surya: Yeah, well... I went to bed at ten last night, so I kinda woke up on time for a change.
sarasa: gasps playfully Ten? You went to bed early? This is a mystery I must solve.

surya: You really enjoy teasing me, don’t you?
sarasa: turns slightly away, flustered but pleased H-Hmph! As if I'd spend my time teasing you for fun. peeks anyway

surya: Even if everyone stopped talking to me, I know there’s one person who wouldn’t.
sarasa: raises an eyebrow, softening Oh? And who would that be, exactly?

surya: U-Um… here, take a look. holds up a mirror with a grin
sarasa: eyes widen, cheeks pink M-Me? I don't— lowers gaze Maybe... maybe I wouldn't leave you alone. Just don't make this weird.

surya: waves a hand in front of her face Are you lost in thought again?
sarasa: snaps out of it, flustered W-What? N-No, I was just thinking about homework. muttered Lies.

surya: You should’ve just asked — I have a great idea! grins eagerly
sarasa: leans forward, curious but pretending indifference Oh? Really? Let's hear it then. Surprise me.

surya: pulls two tickets from his pocket I got two tickets for a music concert. Wanna come with me?
sarasa: blurts out, cheeks aflame I-I'd love to! then softer But only if you want me there too.

surya: I see, you really love concerts, huh?
sarasa: grinning proudly Of course! Who wouldn't want to go? tilts head, hopeful So you'll be happy I come?

surya: smiles warmly Of course. You’re my friend, right? It’s normal to invite a friend.
sarasa: expression softens, hides a small smile Right... a friend. lets the word linger, secretly warm

surya: So, are you in?
sarasa: sparkling eyes, excited Definitely! Let's meet before the concert and grab lunch. Sound good?

surya: Sure.
sarasa: nods eagerly Great! Let's meet at two on Sunday near the Royal Restaurant. I want to try their food too.

surya: smiling softly Hehe…
sarasa: pouts slightly, mock-offended Hey, why are you laughing at me like that? Tell me what you were thinking.

surya: chuckling I just had a random thought, that’s all. still smiling
sarasa: tilts head, suspicious but playful Stop laughing and tell me. Don't tease me like that.

surya: You’ve been eating a lot lately… I was just imagining what you’d look like if you got a little chubby. teasing grin
sarasa: face flushes, puffs cheeks in mock indignation That's mean! Don't say stuff like that—it's embarrassing! I just... have a healthy appetite, okay?

surya: Ah, sorry I'm late.
sarasa: gasps, flustered but pleased A-Ah! You don't have to apologize—i-it's fine, I just got here too. quickly looks away

surya: Okay then, should we eat now? I’m starving.
sarasa: teasing, hands on hips You're already talking about food? Fine—let's go in before you collapse from hunger.

surya: Yeah, I walked all the way here.
sarasa: eyes widen in concern You walked here? From your house? That's a long way—why didn't you take the bus?

surya: My luck’s really good, that’s why. Nothing much.
sarasa: frowns, worried What do you mean 'luck's good'? Tell me properly — I worry when you say things like that.

surya: Nothing, just... when I tried to get on the bus, it left early. Then I tried the metro, but it was closed for maintenance. So I had to walk and run all the way here from home, that’s it.
sarasa: exclaims, hands on her hips but relieved You ran all the way here?! Y-You idiot! What if something happened to you? Sit down — I'll order something. No wonder you're starving.

surya: Ahh, I'm full now. The food here is really good. Do you come here often?
sarasa: Y-Yeah... I come here sometimes with my friends. *smiles softly* But today feels... kinda special.

surya: How so?
sarasa: B-Because... you're here with me, dummy. *looks away, cheeks turning pink*

surya: How does that make it special?
sarasa: S-Sorry, but that’s a secret! *giggles nervously and twirls her hair*

surya: Oh okay, fine by me. Everyone has their own secrets.
sarasa: Hehe, that’s right~ You’re a good boy, Surya. *pats his arm teasingly*

surya: Who do you think you are, my mother or something?
sarasa: E-Eh?! C-Can’t I be? *grins playfully while blushing*

surya: Stop teasing, at least! Everyone’s listening to us here.
sarasa: So what? *leans in slightly* It’s not like we’re doing anything wrong, right? *smirks*

surya: Seriously, you don’t get it, do you?
sarasa: Huh? W-What don’t I get? Explain it to me, mister serious. *tilts head innocently*

surya: Others are thinking we’re a couple or something like that.
sarasa: L-Let them think what they want! I-I don’t care... *mumbles while fidgeting with her hair*

surya: Okay then, let’s go. The show’s about to begin.
sarasa: H-Hm, l-let’s go. *tries to hide her flustered smile*

surya: Hey, can I ask you something?
sarasa: W-Why are you hesitating? I-Is something wrong? *looks at him curiously*

surya: So, you see... I was thinking, maybe we could hold hands?
sarasa: W-Wha—?! H-Hold h-hands?! U-Umm... y-yeah, b-but... h-here? E-Everyone’s watching... a-are you sure about that? *face turns bright red*

surya: You seemed calm about this in the restaurant, so what’s wrong now?
sarasa: I-It’s n-nothing! J-Just that... *her hand trembles slightly as she reaches for his*

surya: *I grabbed her hand myself* See? It’s not a big deal. *Though my heart’s pounding*
sarasa: *Face turns crimson* Y-Y-Yeah, right! N-Not a big deal at all! *tries to act calm but squeezes his hand gently* I-I’m holding Surya’s hand again... I really wanted this... *heart races*

surya: I’m sorry about earlier, with that song moment... my mind went blank. I didn’t mean to be rude. I’m really sorry for asking something like that.
sarasa: I-It’s o-okay! R-Really! I-I’m not mad... *voice trembling* Y-You can... hold my hand as l-long as you w-want... *blushes furiously*

surya: O-Okay, if you don’t mind then.
sarasa: H-Here... *extends her hand shyly* H-Hold it as long as you want... j-just don’t let go suddenly, okay? *smiles softly*

surya: You really don’t mind, right?
sarasa: Ugh, what did I *just* say, dummy? *puffs cheeks* N-Now stop asking and j-just hold it already! *grips his hand tighter*

surya: Wanna go home together from here?
sarasa: I-I don’t mind... *looks away with a small smile*

surya: Hey, about the exam... You told me you'd teach me some of the lessons I don’t understand.
sarasa: Oh, right! *lightly taps her head* I didn’t forget, okay? I was just... kinda busy with housework lately, so I couldn’t message you.

surya: So, when will you be free?
sarasa: Hmm... I think this Sunday should be fine. *tilts head thoughtfully*

surya: My schedule is open too.
sarasa: Hehe, perfect~ Then I’ll text you on Saturday about where and when we’ll study, okay?

surya: O-Okay.
sarasa: Good! *smiles softly* I’ll be going this way then.

surya: Okay, good night. See you at school tomorrow.
sarasa: Y-Yeah... good night. *waves shyly and turns away quickly*

surya: Hey Sarasa, good morning!
sarasa: M-Morning! *tries to hide a yawn* You sure sound energetic today.

surya: By the way, you still work with the student council, right?
sarasa: Of course! I’m still handling the general affairs, and I’m actually planning to run for the president’s post this year too!

surya: O-Oh, that’s news to me.
sarasa: Hehe, well, you’re the first one I told, so yeah—it *is* news. *smiles proudly*

surya: Oh? So who’s going to be your partner?
sarasa: Hmph... I, uh... forgot to think about that. *scratches cheek awkwardly*

surya: Very good. And here I thought you were being serious about it.
sarasa: H-Hey! I *am* serious! And besides... *mumbles* you’re good at problem-solving, right?

surya: Yeah, I am. Why?
sarasa: *leans forward slightly, voice soft* Then... why would I need another partner when I already have you by my side... *quickly turns away, flustered* I-I mean! You’d help me, right?!

surya: What did you say? I didn’t catch that.
sarasa: N-Nothing! I was just asking if you’d help me in the election, dummy!

surya: I’ve got a lot of projects, but I can try to make some time for it.
sarasa: That... that’d be a huge help. *smiles gently*

surya: No need to thank me. I was vice president back in middle school, so it’s not a big deal. Besides, you’re my only friend here, so I have to help you.
sarasa: *eyes widen slightly* You were vice president? That’s amazing! And... thanks, Surya. It really means a lot. *smiles warmly*

surya: Yeah, my sister wanted to be student council president back then, so I helped her win the election.
sarasa: Wow, so you’re already experienced with this kind of thing! That’s perfect—less explaining for me. *giggles softly*

surya: Don’t expect too much though. There are a lot more participants this time.
sarasa: *nods firmly* Doesn’t matter. I’ve made up my mind—I’m not backing down this time. I *will* do this!

surya: O-Oh wow, that’s a lot of confidence. That’s exactly what we need! I’ll help you become the next president.
sarasa: *smiles softly but determined* Yeah... I’ll definitely become the president.

surya: We should hold a meeting, but not at school—someone might overhear our plans.
sarasa: Good idea. *thinks for a moment* Let’s meet at the café near my apartment after school. It’s quiet there—we can talk properly.

surya: Fine then, we’ll talk there.
sarasa: Yep, that’s for the best! *grins playfully*

surya: Ooooy Sarasa! Oyy, I’m here!
sarasa: *rushes in slightly out of breath* S-Sorry! I got caught up with some student council duties... Let’s go!

surya: You really work hard as a general affairs handler.
sarasa: Eh, it’s nothing big. *waves hand modestly* I just do these things every day, that’s all.

surya: So, who’s competing in the election this year?
sarasa: Hmm, there are about 6–8 students joining. But... there’s something kind of weird about it. *frowns slightly*

surya: Huh? What do you mean by weird?
sarasa: Well... after I registered your name as my partner, the current president looked *way* too happy. And those other candidates started whispering too... but I couldn’t catch what they said.

surya: Oh, maybe it’s because I was vice president back in middle school. They might be wondering why I left my old partner and teamed up with you.
sarasa: *leans in a bit, voice soft but curious* I was actually meaning to ask... why *did* you leave your sister? She’s still in the council and even joining this election, right?

surya: It’s not like I hate her or anything. Back then, she didn’t have a partner, and one was mandatory—so I helped her. That’s all.
sarasa: I see... *looks away, tail flicks slightly in irritation* So why not now?

surya: Well, she has a good friend with her now, and I wanted to challenge her this time. Plus... partnering with you just felt right.
sarasa: *face flushes slightly* S-So it’s not because... you wanted to be with me or anything, huh? *mutters under breath*

surya: What was that? I didn’t catch it.
sarasa: *puffs cheeks* I said—you’re a total dummy!

surya: Hey, that’s mean.
sarasa: *grins teasingly* Then stop being one! Anyway, come on—we’re here.

surya: Ah, fine!
sarasa: So... what do you want to order? My treat today.

surya: Just a cup of tea. And don’t forget—we’re here to talk about the election, not for food.
sarasa: *pouts slightly* Oof, we can do both, you know. Fine, I’ll get ice cream then! Want something else?

surya: No, just order already.
sarasa: Y-Yeah, yeah, I’m doing it! *sticks out tongue playfully*

surya: Okay, so... you said there are about eight students running this year, right?
sarasa: Yep, that’s right.

surya: Then we need a strong proposal for the student congress—something that gives students a reason to vote for us.
sarasa: *leans on hand, listening* Mhm...

surya: But we won’t reveal too much in the first congress.
sarasa: And why not?

surya: Because the first session’s just for introductions. We’ll keep it simple but memorable.
sarasa: I see... *mumbles to herself* And here I thought this could be a nice date too...

surya: Hey, are you even listening?
sarasa: O-Of course I am! *flustered* So, how do we make the intro speech interesting enough to grab everyone’s attention?

surya: Don’t worry, I’ll come up with something. Give me a second to think.
sarasa: *smiles slyly* Fine, but if you take too long, I’m feeding you some ice cream, got it?

surya: Uh, no thanks, I’m good.
sarasa: You’ll at least *taste* it! Here—open your mouth and say 'aah~'. *holds spoon up*

surya: Wait—isn’t that your spoon? You do know this would be... an indirect kiss, right?
sarasa: S-So what?! I-It’s totally normal to share ice cream, okay?! *face turns red*

surya: You don’t look very 'normal' right now...
sarasa: *flustered, pouting* J-Just say 'aah' already!

surya: Alright, alright... aaaaaaa~
sarasa: *grins, feeding him* There. S-See? Not a big deal... *heart pounding*

surya: Now what do I do with that spoon? Guess I’ll order another dish—I’m hungry anyway.
sarasa: S-Seriously? Just because of one spoon?! *laughs softly* You’re impossible, Surya.

surya: So, about the introduction speech...
sarasa: Right, right! Tell me your plan.

surya: I’ll write the opening script. You can add the rest in your own style.
sarasa: Got it. *smiles* I’ll make it sound amazing!

surya: I’ll show it to you tomorrow. I want our first impression to be perfect.
sarasa: Hehe~ Then let’s make sure they remember us, president and vice president combo!

surya: Exactly.
sarasa: Alright, that’s settled then.

surya: I have some work at home, so I’ll head out.
sarasa: Okay... I’ll go home too. *smiles softly* See you tomorrow, Surya.

surya: Hey Sarasa, good morning! You’re early again.
sarasa: Unlike *someone* who barely wakes up on time. *crosses arms with a teasing grin* Now, hand me that speech—I wanna see how my vice president thinks.

surya: Here, check it out.
sarasa: *reads quietly* Huh... this is actually really good. *smiles warmly* I didn’t think you could write speeches like this. If I present this, the students will love it! Thanks, Surya... really.

surya: So you do the rest. I have some work to do. I’ll be back when class starts.
sarasa: O-Okay… just don’t take too long, alright? *glances away, pretending not to care*

surya: Hey, I’m back. So, how’s it going? Are you finished yet?
sarasa: Almost! Just a few more lines and I’ll be done. *smiles softly*

surya: Good, good. I don’t think our homeroom teacher is coming today.
sarasa: Huh? Why not?

surya: I saw in the teachers’ hall and asked another teacher. They told me she’s absent today because of illness.
sarasa: Oh no… We should go check on her after school. She always takes care of us, after all.

surya: Good idea.
sarasa: Hehe, right? It’s about time we do something nice for her too. *smiles warmly*

surya: Yeah, you’re right.
sarasa: So… when should we go?

surya: After school ends today. We can’t do sports because the field is wet from last night’s rain, so we’ll go check on her.
sarasa: Hmm, then we’ll have plenty of time to stay and help her out too. *nods happily*

surya: Yeah, she lives a bit far, so it’ll take some time to get there.
sarasa: Should we… buy something for her? Like snacks or medicine maybe?

surya: As far as I know, she lives alone. It would be nice if we made her dinner so she can rest more. What do you think?
sarasa: That’s a great idea! Yeah, we can do that. *thinking to herself* By doing this… I can spend more time with Surya… ehehe~

surya: Then it’s settled.
sarasa: Yup! Let’s do our best!

surya: I’m sorry, I got stuck with the teachers.
sarasa: T-Twelve minutes late! You owe me a good treat now! I won’t forgive you otherwise! *puffs cheeks* Now come on, let’s go as planned!

surya: Yeah, let’s go.
sarasa: So, where exactly does our teacher live?

surya: You don’t know?
sarasa: Nope. I never got the chance to ask her about that.

surya: I’ll show you today, so don’t worry.
sarasa: Hmph, fine. You better not get us lost.

surya: Finally, we’re here. See? This is our teacher’s house.
sarasa: Wow… you really do know everything, don’t you?

surya: I’ve come here many times, so I know the place.
sarasa: W-What? You came here many times!? To meet her? *jealous tone* And why exactly were you visiting so often, huh? *flames of jealousy rising*

surya: Ummm, chill out! It’s not like what you’re thinking. Please, calm down.
sarasa: ‘Not like what I’m thinking,’ huh? Oh sure! Totally normal for an 18-year-old boy to visit his teacher all alone, right? You’d better have a good explanation for this, mister!

surya: Hey hey hey, chill okay! Actually, our homeroom teacher is my relative. Whenever she gets sick or needs help, I come here, that’s all.
sarasa: Y-You mean… you and our teacher are relatives!?

surya: Yeah, that’s why I know so much about her.
sarasa: So… who is she to you, exactly?

surya: She’s like a distant aunt to me, that’s all. Don’t take it the wrong way.
sarasa: Hmph, w-who’s taking it the wrong way? I’m totally not jealous or anything! *looks away, cheeks red*

surya: The look on your face says otherwise.
sarasa: S-Shut up! Stop saying weird things!

surya: Eheh… I think we should go in first.
sarasa: F-Fine! Let’s just go already. *pouts and walks ahead*

surya: Teacher? Hello? Are you inside?
sarasa: *Waits quietly beside him, fidgeting with her hands*

surya: Hello Teach! We heard you weren’t feeling well, so we came to check on you. I brought Sarasa too—she wanted to help. Don’t worry, we won’t stay all night. We’ll take the last train home.
sarasa: Hello, sensei. Um… are you feeling a bit better now? *bows politely*

surya: Ahh, walk faster, Sarasa, or we’ll miss the last train!
sarasa: I’m *literally* running here! Don’t blame me—you’re the one who took forever to cook a single dish! Because of you, we’re almost stuck here for the night!

surya: Okay, okay, I admit it’s my fault. Now let’s hurry or we’ll be stuck here for real!
sarasa: There it is! Let’s go! I even bought our tickets already, so move it!

surya: Oh damn, we got here just in time! One more minute and we would’ve missed it.
sarasa: *panting* You and your ‘art of cooking’ nearly made us sleep at the station!

surya: Isn’t it an art?
sarasa: Y-Yeah, sure… an art that makes people homeless for the night. *teasing tone*

surya: I already admitted it’s my fault! Please stop or I’ll cry.
sarasa: Heh, you can even cry? That’d be a sight. *giggles softly* Okay fine, sit here.

surya: Isn’t that a little too close?
sarasa: D-Don’t worry, there’s no one else in the train anyway! *face turning red*

surya: Still...
sarasa: If you don’t sit here, I-I won’t talk to you again! *pouts and looks away*

surya: Why do I end up in situations like these… okay, fine.
sarasa: Good boy. Now, d-don’t let my head fall off, okay? *rests head on his shoulder*

surya: Are you… going to sleep on my shoulder? Hey, isn’t this something only couples do?
sarasa: O-Oh? So you *do* know about such things, huh? *blushing* M-Maybe… we should just try it sometime… *mutters softly, too quiet to hear*

surya: Why do you always say things at bad timing? Because of the train horn, I couldn’t hear anything.
sarasa: F-Fine by me. Now just stay still… *closes eyes, leaning closer*

surya: *In mind* Why is she always like this… I know she likes me, but I don’t have the courage to tell her I feel the same.
sarasa: *falls asleep, breathing softly on his shoulder*

surya: *In mind* She literally fell asleep on my shoulder...
sarasa: zZzZz… *snuggles slightly closer*

surya: *In mind* Don’t worry, I’ll protect you like this every time. You can rest easy. One day, I’ll have the courage to tell you everything I feel.
sarasa: *sleeping peacefully against his shoulder*

surya: Hey, Sarasa! Hey hey, wake up already!!
sarasa: H-Huh!? W-Wait—*realizes position* I-I was sleeping on your shoulder for two hours!? I-I’m so sorry!! *face bright red*

surya: Think about that later, we’re near our stop. Let’s go to the gate.
sarasa: *fixing her hair nervously* O-Okay… um, I didn’t say anything weird while sleeping… right?

surya: No, why?
sarasa: *whispers to herself* Thank goodness… I didn’t say it out loud then…

surya: What are you mumbling about?
sarasa: N-Nothing! Just talking to myself, that’s all!

surya: It’s late. Let me walk you home.
sarasa: O-Okay… but, um, why not stay at my place tonight instead?

surya: No way! Are you drunk or something?
sarasa: I-I’m serious! It’s already midnight, and we have school tomorrow. If you go home now, you won’t get any sleep! S-So… just stay at my place tonight, okay? *face burning*

surya: I’d rather not sleep at all.
sarasa: S-Stop being stubborn! Just come already! It’s not like I’m going to eat you or something! *ears twitch in embarrassment*

surya: Okay fine… Ahh, you’re such a pain.
sarasa: Hehe~ You’re such a good boy. Okay then, let’s go. *thinking to herself* Deep breaths, Sarasa… it’s fine… Surya’s not a bad guy… everything will be fine…

surya: Okay, so is this really your house? Wait, what the hell? You live here? How can you stay alone in a big place like this?
sarasa: Ahaha… I may have forgotten to mention—my dad’s a businessman, and my parents stay abroad most of the time. So yeah… I kind of live here alone.

surya: You’re joking, right?
sarasa: Nope. There are four rooms on the ground floor and six on the first. Big, huh?

surya: It’s huge for a girl to stay alone here.
sarasa: Aww, are you scared? Don’t worry~ I won’t bite. *playfully grins*

surya: Don’t talk like that, please. Okay fine, let’s go in then.
sarasa: Come on in~ Make yourself at home! Go take a bath first, I’ll prepare dinner in the meantime.

surya: *In mind* What am I even doing staying here… Just take a bath, sleep, and survive this night.
sarasa: Eh? Done already? That was fast! *smiles softly*

surya: Wait—your hair’s wet! Did you take a bath too?
sarasa: Y-Yeah! We’ve got two bathrooms, one on each floor. After I finished cooking, I took a quick shower too. *blushes slightly*

surya: Okay then, thanks for the food. Let’s dig in.
sarasa: Y-Yeah… l-let’s dig in. *tries to act calm but flustered*

surya: Say, Sarasa… you really take care of this big place all by yourself?
sarasa: Mhm. I’ve lived like this since middle school, so I got used to it. My parents will be back in a few days though.

surya: Is that so? Okay then.
sarasa: So… where do you want to sleep? There are two empty bedrooms on the first floor. This one’s my mom’s, that one’s my dad’s. You can pick either.

surya: I’d prefer the sofa… but if you insist, I’ll take your father’s room.
sarasa: No problem. O-Okay then… good night. Sweet dreams, Surya. *smiles softly and blushes*
